name: VYLOY
indications: vyloy , combination fluoropyrimidine- platinum-containing chemotherapy , indicated first-line treatment adults locally advanced unresectable metastatic human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 ( her2 ) ‑negative gastric gastroesophageal junction ( gej ) adenocarcinoma whose tumors claudin ( cldn ) 18.2 positive determined fda-approved test [ ( 2.1 ) ( 14 ) ] .
contraindications: • administer intravenous infusion . administer vyloy intravenous push bolus . ( 2.6 ) • recommended first dose vyloy 800 mg/m 2 followed 600 mg/m 2 every 3 weeks 400 mg/m 2 every 2 weeks . ( 2.3 )
indications_original: VYLOY, in combination with fluoropyrimidine- and platinum-containing chemotherapy, is indicated for the first-line treatment of adults with locally advanced unresectable or metastatic human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2)‑negative gastric or gastroesophageal junction (GEJ) adenocarcinoma whose tumors are claudin (CLDN) 18.2 positive as determined by an FDA-approved test [see Dosage and Administration (2.1) and Clinical Studies (14)].
contraindications_original: • Administer by intravenous infusion only . Do not administer VYLOY as an intravenous push or bolus. ( 2.6 ) • The recommended first dose of VYLOY is 800 mg/m 2 followed by 600 mg/m 2 every 3 weeks or 400 mg/m 2 every 2 weeks. ( 2.3 )
